FINANCE MANAGER

SUMMARY

Efficient, dedicated, hard-working Financial Manager skilled at consistently meeting strict deadlines, paying high attention to detail and effectiveness when reporting to senior management.
Extensive experience in budgeting, forecasting, strategic planning and analysis.

EXPERIENCE

Company Name
March 2003
to
Current
Finance Manager
City ,
State
Serving as a business and financial advisor to a portfolio of ten trade show teams by working closely with Senior Management, Industry Vice Presidents, and Sales Directors, as well as the Operations, Registration, Marketing, and Conference departments
Prepare detailed show budgets, monthly financial forecasts, strategic plan projections, and financial analysis of the P&L's for ten trade shows.  Manage these tasks effectively to complete on a timely basis, and within strict deadlines
Analyze show revenue and expenses versus budget/forecast and provide analysis on variances.  Review general ledger accounts, prepare journal entries and support schedules as needed to discuss findings with show management
Perform due diligence for potential business acquisitions, and then prepare and present the financial models to Senior Management
Assist Show Management with decisions relating to exhibit space, advertising and media product pricing, as well as customer package creation and pricing
Review and approve all purchase orders, vendor invoices, and expense reports relating to shows and ensure all documents are in accordance with company policies
Monitor sales and marketing results against established milestones and expense commitments relating to new show launches
Review key business contracts related to events and provide guidance and information on financial and non-financial matters to event teams
Manage onsite trade show financial needs which includes establishing banking requirements, preparing and reconciling financial documents onsite, and training and supervising cashiers and temporary help at the show
Partner with and maintain professional relationships with key association and business partners within trade show events
Created and implemented financial reports which detail customer packages sold by show teams.  These reports are mainly used by Finance, Sales and Operations teams
Redesigned and streamlined the Show Set Up Process that is used by Finance, Accounting, and Sales departments
Monitor accounts receivable and assist collections and sales with determining collectability
Collaborate with Reed Exhibitions France on cross border events held in the U.S.  Provide financial support on these events and assist with onsite
event needs
Assist in the interviewing process for new team members, as
well as help train new staff accountants and finance managers within the
department
Streamlined and automated Interim and Year-End audit process
for the finance and accounting departments which made it more effecient for the auditors to review reconciliations and financials

Analyzed financial statements and created reports for management which were used to formulate future investment strategies Primary liaison between all levels of management of the portfolio companies and the private equity division of Bowman Capital.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Title: Director of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) for a PE-Backed Company
East 57th Street Partners is currently on the lookout for a dynamic and insightful Director of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) on behalf of one of our premier clients. This key role is a full-time opportunity perfect for a finance professional who excels in advanced financial analysis, strategic planning, and leadership within a private equity-backed setting. The Director of FP&A will be instrumental in guiding the financial strategy and ensuring robust financial planning and analysis to support the company's growth and value creation initiatives.
Role Overview:As a vital member of the executive leadership team, the Director of FP&A will oversee the company's FP&A functions, including budgeting, forecasting, performance tracking, and financial analysis. The ideal candidate will blend strategic insight with analytical prowess, demonstrating a track record of improving financial performance and strategic decision-making.
Key Responsibilities:Lead the development and execution of the company’s financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting processes, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.Direct and enhance the financial analysis functions, providing deep insights into business performance, opportunities for improvement, and strategic investment.Play a pivotal role in strategic decision-making, offering financial insights and analysis on mergers, acquisitions, investments, and other critical business initiatives.Ensure accuracy and integrity in financial reporting, facilitating informed decision-making across the company.Develop and maintain advanced financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives.Collaborate closely with senior leadership to understand departmental financial needs and goals, integrating them into the broader company financial strategy.Foster relationships with external partners, including financial institutions, investors, and analysts, to support the company’s strategic financial objectives.Lead, mentor, and develop the FP&A team, promoting a culture of high performance and continuous improvement.Qualifications:Proven experience in a Director of FP&A role, or similar, within a complex and dynamic organization, with a successful track record in financial planning and analysis.Strong grasp of financial principles, analytics, and the ability to apply this knowledge in a strategic context.Excellent skills in financial modeling, analysis, and forecasting with proficiency in financial management software (e.g., ERP systems).Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze, interpret, and utilize financial data to make informed decisions.Exceptional leadership, organizational, and communication skills.BSc/BA in Finance, Accounting, or a relevant field; MSc/MBA or relevant certifications (e.g., CPA or CFA) preferred.Benefits:Competitive executive compensation package, including performance incentives and equity options.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance coverage.Employer-contributed retirement savings plan.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.Significant opportunities for professional growth and advancement in a supportive and dynamic environment.
East 57th Street Partners is dedicated to identifying a Director of FP&A who will significantly enhance our client's financial analysis, strategic planning, and overall financial health. This role is ideal for a financial leader passionate about driving strategic insights, fostering innovation, and enhancing financial performance at every level of the organization.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
